pr_title: [PD$-110002] Part 2: Economising Snapshot Transaction commitWrites() Timers

timeline.bodyText:
I think this comment, in isolation, is not that useful: I assume it is explaining why this is not timed, but outside of the context of this PR it doesn't really imply. Perhaps:
// Not timed because TransactionService.putUnlessExists actually commits the transaction, and is timed
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: That's a fair point. Makes sense
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText:
You've mentioned:
"refreshing commit locks: consider ConjureTimelockServiceBlocking.refreshLockLeases"
in the changelog, but I don't see a comment here in the code (where you have for others that are no longer timed). Is it perhaps adding a comment?
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: Yep, I'll add one. I think I left this out as I thought it was obvious, but probably worth doing for the sake of completeness
replies.author: jeremyk-91
